page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Eastfield Estate has 35 old people's bungalows supervised by a warden.We interviewed several residents from the estate:Mr.V.Howard,a retired sea captain who used to sail around the world in sailing ships.His first sailing was in 1919 at the age of 15. He gained his captain's ticket at the age of 24.A Mr.Everett has lived in Roos since 1908 and attended Roos School,where there were three teachers his teacher was Miss Gardener.He began work,aged 13 years,leaving school early because of the war.He worked at Ogram's farm for 15/-a week.Every Sunday they went to the Primitive Chapel,3 times.Once a year they went to Withernsea for the day using horse drawn wagons loaned by local farmers. He remembered the first car and tractor in the village owned by Mr.Mace.
